summary: Comprehensive testing of Tesla Supercharger Network Explorer completed successfully. All backend APIs (8/8) and frontend features working perfectly. Interactive map with 12 superchargers, color-coded availability markers, trip planning, amenity filters, and glassmorphism design all functional.
passed_tests: Backend API root endpoint (200 OK)
Get all 12 superchargers with valid structure
Get specific supercharger by ID with complete details
404 error handling for non-existent superchargers
Trip planning API (SF to LA, 559km, 1 charging stop)
Input validation for invalid trip data (422 error)
Vehicle profile save and retrieve functionality
Interactive map loads with all 12 supercharger locations
Color-coded availability markers (green: 60%+, yellow: 30-60%, red: <30%)
Supercharger marker click opens detailed info panel
Details panel shows name, address, availability (18/24), power (250kW), amenities
Close button functionality on details panel
Vehicle model dropdown selection (Model 3 to Model S)
Charge slider interaction (shows 80%, adjustable to 30%)
Amenity filters: restrooms, food, wifi, shopping, lounge all functional
Multiple amenity filter combinations (wifi+shopping+lounge = 0 markers)
Trip planner: origin/destination coordinate inputs work
Plan Trip button triggers successful API call
Trip summary displays: distance (559km), duration (7.4 hours), stops (1)
Blue polyline route visualization on map
Navigate button functionality in details panel
Glassmorphism panels with backdrop-blur-xl effects (2 panels detected)
Responsive design: desktop (1920x1080), tablet (768x1024), mobile (390x844)
Dark theme implementation with proper contrast
No error messages or console errors detected

success_percentage.design: 100% (glassmorphism, responsive design, color coding all working)
